frameDefinitions: An Agent or Entity becomes sufficient enough to meet a Standard.
A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier. ''

This frame concerns Acts and State_of_Affairs for which Protagonists are responsible and which either follow or violate some set of rules  or Norms. '' 'A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money violates the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.'
A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.
This frame describes an Agent or an Entity meeting or not meeting a Standard.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
frameExamples: This paper does not <t>meet</t> the requirements for graduation.
Making services <t>accessible</t> to those with special needs is expensive.
A lot of people suspect that blocking savers' access to their money <t>violates</t> the new constitution's explicit ban on compulsory loans to the government.
Will my coursework <t>satisfy</t> the requirements for admission?
listRoleDefinitions: The intentional <fen>Agent</fen> acts to meet to a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The non-intentional <fen>Entity</fen> becomes sufficient enough to meet a <fen>Standard</fen>.
An act or occurence that changes circumstances sufficiently so as to meet a <fen>Standard</fen>.
A condition or requirement that the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> attempt to meet.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> becomes sufficient in regards to the <fen>Standard</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.
An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
The <fen>Protagonist</fen>'s behavior is in or out of compliance with norms.
This role identifies the <fen>Act</fen> that is judged to be in or out of compliance with the <fen>Norm</fen>s.
A <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> may violate a law or rule.
This role identifies the rules or <fen>Norm</fen>s that ought to guide a person's behavior.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen>  when the act of compliance or non-compliance occurs.
This role identifies the name of the <fen>Process</fen> that occurs.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The volitional <fen>Agent</fen> who is in line with a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The non-agentive <fen>Entity</fen> that is in line with a <fen>Standard</fen>.
An occurrence or action that brings about the satisfaction or nonsatisfaction of a <fen>Standard</fen>.
The condition or requirement that the <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Entity</fen>, or <fen>Event</fen> satisfy (or not).
The <fen>Time</fen> in which satisfaction of the <fen>Standard</fen> occurs.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.
listRoleExamples: Jo's <fex><t>violation</t></fex> of the no trespassing law came as a surprise.
John violated <fex>the law</fex> by not paying taxes.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the second half of the 21st century
the United Nation's 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees
the International Committee on New Integrated Climate Change Assessment Scenarios
a People's Climate Action Plan for SingaporeSpeak for Climate and SG Climate Rally
